title: module files : explicit load and mnemonic suffixes
body:
##### Modifications
- [x] adds a new keyword `load` to the spec subsection in `modules.yaml`
- [x] adds a new keyword `suffixes` to the spec subsection in `modules.yaml`
- [x] generates module files with explicit module load 
- [x] unit tests for `modules.py`
##### Example : explicit load

A configuration file like : 

``` yaml
modules:
  tcl:
    %gcc@4.8:
      load:
        - foo/bar
        - baz
```

will add the following lines to anything compiled with `gcc@4.8`:

``` tcl
if ![ is-loaded foo/bar ] {
    puts stderr "Autoloading foo/bar"
    module load foo/bar
}

if ![ is-loaded baz ] {
    puts stderr "Autoloading baz"
    module load baz
}
```

Dotkit will exhibit the same behavior.
##### Example : mnemonic suffixes

A configuration file like : 

``` yaml
modules:
  tcl:
    hdf5:
      suffixes:
        +mpi: parallel
```

will append to any `hdf5` module file the suffix `parallel` if `+mpi in spec`, producing a module file name like:

```
hdf5-1.10.0-gcc-6.1.0-parallel-vhxsri5po6nzynspknbjbo6uot6stcrv
```

@glennpj This should address the request for features made [here](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/pull/744#issuecomment-211588729), any feedback is welcome
